title: Use circuit to determine if one resistor is ohmic

content.question: A student has a collection of different resistors, a nonideal battery, a voltmeter, and an ammeter. The student wants to use the circuit design shown to determine if one of the resistors is ohmic. Which of the following describes a procedure that would produce data that could be graphed to achieve this goal?

choices.label: Putting the ammeter at Meter <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the voltmeter at Meter <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and varying the resistance at Resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by swapping in different resistors

Putting the ammeter at Meter <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the voltmeter at Meter <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and varying the resistance at Resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by swapping in different resistors

Putting the voltmeter at Meter <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the ammeter at Meter <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and varying the resistance at Resistor <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by swapping in different resistors

Putting the voltmeter at Meter <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the ammeter at Meter <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and varying the resistance at Resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by swapping in different resistors

content.answer: Putting the voltmeter at Meter <math alttext="1" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, the ammeter at Meter <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and varying the resistance at Resistor <math alttext="2" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> by swapping in different resistors

skill.text: 3.B: Apply an appropriate law, definition, theoretical relationship, or model to make a claim.
